intro: Fumana thymifolia var. papillosa, commonly known as the hairy thyme-leaved fumana, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves that emit a strong thyme-like scent. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to its unique morphology and fragrance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
